text: bit of a mixed bag out there today so I want to do a quick market update and then I also want to apologize to you guys there's a couple things I have to come clean on which I'll get into in just a few minutes so talking about the markets first we have a lot of capitulation that's happening right now and it's across all of the indices notice that we had the SP 500 that was down 34 of a percent today NASDAQ was down about half a percent and then the Russell was down almost 2 bid back up to about 1.9 so yeah overall some some pretty fair weakness going on but this isn't like falling out of bed can't get up kind of weakness this looks like a lot of things that have had a insane run from about April mid April until now so it's kind of like if you were to go out and Sprint as fast as you can sooner or later even if you're that dude that can run a sub 2hour Marathon or whatever the hell it is you got to take a break sooner or later so that's kind of what this is to me I see not a significant display of weakness across the market as I look across breath indicators I see net highs lows for example is turning down net highs is absolutely coming down but it's not diving into lows just yet although lows are

text: the options chain we know already that I'm out of my front positions via options I'm waiting for a re-entry we had a ton of volume today there was no slowdown 36,000 contracts traded against for calls against 100,000 puts for the calls the vast majority the overwhelming majority here is in 19 July we can take a look at that at 22 and if we go out and we look at this 26 July expiration there's activity there but it does look like the 16 augs are starting to enter the equation that's what these yellow rectangles are people getting in there so if we compare those really fast for next week's expiration it's only 79,000 it's essentially 80,000 calls versus 32,000 puts and then in 16 a it's 32,800 against 9615 so what I'm seeing now is also fairly standard for what I'm starting to pick up as kind of normal for GameStop where the front expiration cycle especially if it's an Opex is way busier and then the weekly tend to slow down a little bit and then the monthly as it comes up probably will start to pick up a bit you can see that being reflected here literally in the implied volatility the implied volatility for the rest of this week all one day left is 100 55 drops to 131 129 125 then back up to 1315 that's a meaningful discrepancy between these and again it does have earnings coming up on the 4th
